title: Pusher beams SDK extension (server side)
body:
### Description

The purpose of this extension is to integrate Pusher beams server java library to the Quarkus ecosystem and provide native support for it.

Pusher beams is a notification solution (saas) to send notifications to Android, iOS, Web clients (single/grouped notification, topic based notification, authenticated clients notifications)

**What this extension will offer**

- CDI injection of Pusher beams component
- Pusher beams configuration
- Class registration & co
- Support classes to execute Pusher operations
- Support component to handle retry system (automatic handling of 429 HTTP error since Pusher API is rate limited)

**Who this extension is for**
People interested in this extension will be people using Pusher beams product and interested in sending notifications from their Java / Quarkus backend, managing Pusher beams authenticated users, etc.

Interested in this extension, please +1 via the emoji/reaction feature of GitHub (top right).

### Configuration suggestion

```
# default true, to activate/deactivate the extension at build time
quarkus.pusher.beams.enabled=true/false
# minimum configuration required to connect to your pusher beams instance.
quarkus.pusher.beams.instance-id=xxxxxx
quarkus.pusher.beams.secret-key=xxxxxx
# any other optional configuration for this extension. Example: retry system
quarkus.pusher.beams.retry.max=3
quarkus.pusher.beams.retry.delay=1
```

### Additional context

The extension is not yet developed by i already have integrated it in one of my services written with Quarkus.

I just want to share it with the community as well as maintain it in a central place and as an extension so that i can re-use it across multiple services.

This extension should belongs to the Quarkiverse Hub if accepted - i guess.

I'm of course interested in leading the development of this extension as i'm using it inside a Quarkus application and i've already proposed and wrote another extension for Datadog open tracer for Quarkiverse a while ago ([here](https://github.com/quarkiverse/quarkus-datadog-opentracing))
